the road map used by "big tobacco" will be copied with legal marijuana, and addiction rates for marijuana will increase to those we see for tobacco.

Brain cancer: In a study of children with brain cancer compared with healthy children, researchers found that if either parent had been exposed to Roundup during the two years before the child's birth, the chances of the child developing brain cancer doubled.

marijuana-based products can treat or cure cancer.

There are some small randomized controlled trials not focused on cancer patients indicating that whole plant marijuana can relieve pain, but there is ‚Äúlower quality evidence‚Äù surrounding other uses of whole plant marijuana in cancer patients, such as to reduce nausea and vomiting, increase appetite and improve muscle wasting.
marijuana smoking is not associated with an increased risk of developing lung cancer.
people who smoked marijuana actually had lower incidences of cancer compared to non-users of the drug.
cannabis use can help reduce the risk of certain cancers.
marijuana does not treat chronic pain or post-traumatic stress disorder.
marijuana can help battle depression, anxiety, post-traumatic stress disorder, and even addictions to alcohol and painkillers.
cannabinoid receptors, through which marijuana exerts its effects, in a key emotional hub in the brain which is involved in regulating anxiety.
medical marijuana shows potential for treating symptoms of PTSD, depression, and social anxiety.
a survey of medical marijuana users in California revealed that 26.1 percent of participants reported therapeutic benefits for depression, and 37.8 percent reported benefits for anxiety.
study demonstrated strong association between psychological distress and older age, low condom use, alcohol use, illicit drug use, as well as verbal abuse and family violence.
consistent cannabis use can impair short-term memory, decrease alertness, lower reaction time, accelerate muscle fatigue (leading to a shorter exercise sesh), or even cause cardiovascular disease.
ingesting cannabis mimics the very natural process of increasing exercise-induced endocannabinoids
